channel.title: This makes no sense
channel.description: Ok, I leeched the HellzScape server, changed my ip and stuff and then I added it to the "Server Status page". i watch my "run.bat" command prompt and see someone log in and they are trying commands.......but when I try to connect via moparscape client or my own client, it says "error connecting to server, server must be down", so I restart the server and the same message popped up. I need help. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ To sum everything up, My server is allowing others to connect from their IP's, but I cannot connect to my own server with my IP. Any suggestions? In the command box for running the server, when I log in it says, "Client null disconnected (my ip)".

item.title: This makes no sense
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

Chassy13:

Practically every server is a leech from Delta these days. He has to start with a base somewhere.

Agreed 100%

item.title: This makes no sense
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

Devinhdl:

lol, no it hasnt worked, I have no idea why it isnt working for me… if you wanna play on it you can, It just won’t let me log on.

It should work if you used 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 Hmm.

item.title: This makes no sense
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

Devinhdl:

I did change the ip for 127.0.0.0 to my no-ip… ive had people log in already, and i’m guessing that since my client got approved by the server status page then it’s alright to leech if you give the owner all the credit

If you gave owner credits… sighh I guess it’s O.K. but try not to.
anyways did it work?

YOU login using 127.0.0.1 OR 0.0.0.0
DO NOT login using your No-ip.

Read full topic

item.title: This makes no sense
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

First of all, GTFO. Leave the fourms if you’re just going to leech and not make your own server.
Second… did you login using your no-ip? You’re not supposed to. Login using 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Read full topic
